Description: Rim sherd of Western Nile Delta pottery plate; brownish-grey fabric core sandwiched between dull orange margins, with large quantity of mica and limestone inclusions; interior: surface worn; on top of flat projecting rim, incised maeander pattern; exterior: reserved; single repair or suspension hole on edge of rim.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The plate was probably made by a Greek potter at Naukratis; see Schlotzhauer 2012, cat no. NAU 156.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 182, Nau 156, pl. 34i-j)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.32)
